content:
• Monday, November 26, 2012
  • GNRC

    Generac Holdings (NYSE:GNRC) says it's withdrawing its secondary offering, which the company...

    Generac Holdings (NYSE:GNRC) says it's withdrawing its secondary offering, which the company announced earlier today, due to poor market conditions. The stock cratered over 9% during the trading session on the back of the initial announcement of the secondary, and has declined by nearly 18% since peaking on November 5 in the wake of Hurricane Sandy. Shares +7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:50 PM | 3 Comments
  • CLH

    Clean Harbors (NYSE:CLH) says its rolling out a 6M share follow-on public offering of its common...

    Clean Harbors (NYSE:CLH) says its rolling out a 6M share follow-on public offering of its common stock, and that once priced, it plans to commence an additonal private placement of $550M of Senior Notes due 2021. Shares -1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:42 PM
  • THO

    More on Thor Industries (NYSE:THO): FQ1 results miss across-the-board despite a big jump in...

    More on Thor Industries (NYSE:THO): FQ1 results miss across-the-board despite a big jump in total revenue Y/Y. Net profit actually rose 39%, driven by double-digit sales gains, but the recreational vehicle maker's bottom line results were hurt by continuing competitive pricing pressures and a number of nonrecurring expenses. Bus margins were also affected by a shift in product mix toward lower-margin units. Shares -6.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM
  • ACAD

    ACADIA Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACAD) moves higher in after-hours trade following the...

    ACADIA Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACAD) moves higher in after-hours trade following the announcement that it will host a conference call and webcast at 8:00 a.m. EST on Tuesday, November 27, to present the top-line results from its Phase III trial of pimavanserin, a treatment for patients with Parkinson's disease psychosis. Shares +6.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • DDS

    Dillard's (NYSE:DDS) declares $0.05/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward...

    Dillard's (NYSE:DDS) declares $0.05/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 0.23%. For shareholders of record Dec 07. Payable Dec 21. Ex-div date Dec 05. Additionally, the board declares special dividend of $5.00/share payable with regular dividend. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • ACAD

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ACAD +10%. CBAK-OLD +5.6%. LVS +4.6%. OSIS +3.8%. RSH...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ACAD +10%. CBAK-OLD +5.6%. LVS +4.6%. OSIS +3.8%. RSH +3.6%.
     
    After-hours top losers: THO -8.2%. WPRT -3.4%. CHC -2.9%. TUES -2.7%. EQR -2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) declares special dividend of $2.75/share. Forward yield %. For...

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) declares special dividend of $2.75/share. Forward yield %. For shareholders of record Dec 10. Payable Dec 18. Ex-div date Dec 06. Shares +4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • LVS

    More special dividends, and this one - coming from Sheldon Adelson - should be no surprise. Las...

    More special dividends, and this one - coming from Sheldon Adelson - should be no surprise. Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) will issue a special dividend of $2.75/share payable on Dec. 18. It's about double the level of next year's planned annual dividend of $1.40. Shares +4.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 4 Comments
  • DDS

    Dillard's (NYSE:DDS) +3.1% AH after declaring a $5/share special dividend to go with its regular...

    Dillard's (NYSE:DDS) +3.1% AH after declaring a $5/share special dividend to go with its regular quarterly dividend of $0.05/share. The apparel retailer has had a pretty good year.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • THO

    Thor Industries (NYSE:THO): FQ1 EPS of $0.58 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $875.6M (+30% Y/Y)...

    Thor Industries (NYSE:THO): FQ1 EPS of $0.58 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $875.6M (+30% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • BV-OLD

    Bazaarvoice (NASDAQ:BV-OLD): FQ2 EPS of -$0.07 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $38.6M (+54% Y/Y)...

    Bazaarvoice (NASDAQ:BV-OLD): FQ2 EPS of -$0.07 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $38.6M (+54% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • CHC

    China Hydroelectric (NYSE:CHC): Q3 EPS of -$0.02 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $21M (+30% Y/Y)...

    China Hydroelectric (NYSE:CHC): Q3 EPS of -$0.02 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $21M (+30% Y/Y) misses by $6.1M. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • CYTK

    Cytokinetics (CYTK +1.5%) finishes higher after reporting positive Phase IIa data of its drug...

    Cytokinetics (CYTK +1.5%) finishes higher after reporting positive Phase IIa data of its drug candidate tirasemtiv, a treatment for patients with generalized myasthenia gravis. The drug is also is seen as a potential treatment for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • MMR

    McMoRan Exploration's (MMR -22.3%) update of its activities in the Gulf of Mexico fails to slow...

    McMoRan Exploration's (MMR -22.3%) update of its activities in the Gulf of Mexico fails to slow the day's precipitous drop in its shares, despite positive drilling results onshore at Lineham Creek. MMR says it will provide more updates on troubled Davy Jones No. 1 as flow-testing operations progress and a measurable flow test is achieved.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +5.5%) gains after announcing a collaboration agreement with...

    Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +5.5%) gains after announcing a collaboration agreement with University College and the Dubowitz Neuromuscular Centre in London to further develop exon-skipping drug therapies for Duchenne muscular dystrophy.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • INFN

    Infinera (INFN +11.5%) has rallied to $5.41 following news CEO Thomas Fallon bought 50K shares...

    Infinera (INFN +11.5%) has rallied to $5.41 following news CEO Thomas Fallon bought 50K shares last Tuesday and Wednesday at prices of $4.44 and $4.60. Fallon also picked up 100K shares by exercising stock options priced at $2. 15.9% of the optical transmission hardware vendor's float was shorted as of Oct. 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • AMZN

    The first Cyber Monday sales figures are pretty encouraging. IBM estimates early sales rose 24%...

    The first Cyber Monday sales figures are pretty encouraging. IBM estimates early sales rose 24% Y/Y, and ChannelAdvisor claims its client sales via Amazon (AMZN +1.4%) and eBay (EBAY +5%) are up 52% and 57% Y/Y, respectively. IBM and comScore have already published strong figures for online Black Friday sales, as surging mobile activity helps boost demand, perhaps at the expense of traditional retailers. (holiday season forecast)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • IMGN

    ImmunoGen (IMGN +2.6%) gains today after appointing Charles Morris, MB, ChB, MRCP as its new...

    ImmunoGen (IMGN +2.6%) gains today after appointing Charles Morris, MB, ChB, MRCP as its new Chief Development Officer, effective immediately. Dr. Morris will be responsible for leading all aspects of product development and regulatory oversight, and will report directly to president and CEO Daniel Junius.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • AAPL

    Citi and Piper's reports are helping Apple (AAPL +3.1%) turn in another strong performance;...

    Citi and Piper's reports are helping Apple (AAPL +3.1%) turn in another strong performance; shares are now up 16% from their Nov. 16 low. The gains come even though Pac Crest's Andy Hargreaves is slashing estimates (albeit keeping them above consensus) and predicting Apple's gross profit per iPhone unit has peaked after steadily rising for 5 years. Hargreaves now thinks the iPhone 5 will have a cost of goods sold of $370, up from a prior forecast of $353.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 5 Comments
  • GALT

    Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +14.4%) receives a Notice of Allowance from the USPTO for a patent...

    Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +14.4%) receives a Notice of Allowance from the USPTO for a patent of study "Galactose-prolonged polysaccharides in a formulation for antifibrotic therapies". The patent covers use of the company's galactomannan-based carbohydrate galectin inhibitor compounds, for use in patients with chronic liver disease associated with the development of fibrosis, established liver fibrosis or end-stage scarring, or cirrhosis.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • GNRC

    Generac Holdings (GNRC -9%) slides today after the company unveiled a secondary offering of...

    Generac Holdings (GNRC -9%) slides today after the company unveiled a secondary offering of around 11.5M shares on behalf of its biggest shareholder and members of the company's board and senior management. Generac, which is the leading maker of standby residential-backup generators, has seen its stock jump over 40% recently on the back of Hurricane Sandy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • AMCO

    China Armco Metals (CNAM +12.5%) ramps up today after the metal recycler and distributor of...

    China Armco Metals (CNAM +12.5%) ramps up today after the metal recycler and distributor of imported metal ore said its subsidiary, Armco Renewable Metals, has signed a sales agreement with China Metal Recycling to deliver a total of 60M metric tons of various scrap steels to China Metal Recycling over the next three months. The market price will be determined at time of delivery.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • AMZN

    Whole Foods Market (WFM -3.3%) trades weak without any specific news out to tip sentiment....

    Whole Foods Market (WFM -3.3%) trades weak without any specific news out to tip sentiment. Though some traders speculate the supermarket chain could lose sales as tension over the fiscal cliff impact builds, a natural cooling off for shares after they ran up 32% YTD seems just as likely a scenario. SA author Stock Gamer warned on the stock last week, noting the current valuation on WFM already baked in a healthy growth premium to peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 4 Comments
  • ENMD

    EntreMed (ENMD +23.7%) soars today after reporting positive results from preclinical breast...

    EntreMed (ENMD +23.7%) soars today after reporting positive results from preclinical breast cancer studies of its oral Aurora A/angiogenic kinase inhibitor, ENMD-2076. Results indicated that the drug exhibited robust anticancer activity against a particularly difficult to treat subtype called "triple-negative" breast cancer. The data provides the basis for a predictive biomarker strategy to explore in future clinical trials.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • MMR

    Natural gas explorers are taking a beating amid expectations for warmer weather across much of...

    Natural gas explorers are taking a beating amid expectations for warmer weather across much of the U.S. over the next week or two that could lead to more additions to gas stockpiles. McMoRan Exploration (MMR -12.9%) leads a broad descent among nat gas firms (UNG -3.7%): PXP -3.9%, WTI -2.8%, EXXI -4.2%, SGY -2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • SQNM

    Shares of Sequenom (SQNM +7%) jump today after Stephens upgraded the stock to Overweight based...

    Shares of Sequenom (SQNM +7%) jump today after Stephens upgraded the stock to Overweight based on the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists Committee on Genetics recommendation that cell-free fetal DNA testing be used in high-risk women. The firm also doubles its price target to $8 from $4.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • CAM

    Raymond James doesn't seem impressed by Cameron's (CAM -1.4%) $275M order from South...

    Raymond James doesn't seem impressed by Cameron's (CAM -1.4%) $275M order from South Korea’s STX Offshore & Shipbuilding. "It is still a bit early to get excited" by CAM's award, the firm says; while National Oilwell Varco (NOV -1.8%) likely will maintain its dominant market position in drilling equipment, the impact of the STX deal on CAM’s balance sheet “could be fairly significant."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • ILMN

    Ilumina (ILMN -3.6%) slips today on a Baird dowgrade to Neutral. Baird says there are near-term...

    Ilumina (ILMN -3.6%) slips today on a Baird dowgrade to Neutral. Baird says there are near-term M&A risks, specifically citing ILMN's own bid for Complete Genomics (GNOM +0.2%) while chatter resurfaces about Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) potentially trying to buy ILMN again after falling to reach a deal earlier this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • VRSN

    VeriSign (VRSN -2.5%) is slumping after receiving a downgrade to Equal Weight from boutique...

    VeriSign (VRSN -2.5%) is slumping after receiving a downgrade to Equal Weight from boutique i-bank First Analysis. Shares have been pressured this fall by concerns about regulatory reviews of VeriSign's 6-year renewal contract for handling the Dot.com domain name registry.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • ZGNX

    Zogenix (ZGNX +2%) moves up after saying it's appointed R. Scott Shively as its new chief...

    Zogenix (ZGNX +2%) moves up after saying it's appointed R. Scott Shively as its new chief commercial officer. Mr. Shively will be responsible for all of the company's commercial strategies and operations including the marketing for ZGNX's Sumavel DosePro, as well as the anticipated launch of ZohydroTM ER, which is pending FDA approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +4.1%) is adding to Friday's 10% gain, which followed a report the...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +4.1%) is adding to Friday's 10% gain, which followed a report the struggling telecom equipment vendor is in talks with Goldman about a loan. Shares are still only at $1.15, down 53% from the end of February.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 2 Comments
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD +7.9%) and Stratasys (SSYS +8%) are both posting big gains. This morning, 3D...

    3D Systems (DDD +7.9%) and Stratasys (SSYS +8%) are both posting big gains. This morning, 3D announced the availability of new models for its ProJet and CPXMax professional 3D printer lines. The announcement comes ahead of the Nov. 27-30 EuroMold industry conference.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (BSX +2.7%) bucks a down tape this morning on an upgrade to Buy at Citigroup....

    Boston Scientific (BSX +2.7%) bucks a down tape this morning on an upgrade to Buy at Citigroup. The firm says BSX is positioned to be the biggest winner from St. Jude Medical's (STJ -1%) Durata troubles. Citi expects it will be taken off the market within six months, and the ripple effects are likely to cost STJ around $820M in annual sales. BSX could easily take 41% of that market share, with Medtronic (MDT -0.9%) absorbing around 29%. Citi's upgrade differs widely from comments made on Friday by BofA Merrill, which put the risk of a Durata recall well below 50%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • KHC

    Heinz (HNZ -1.6%) trades lower after Stifel Nicolaus downgrades the company to Hold from Buy...

    Heinz (HNZ -1.6%) trades lower after Stifel Nicolaus downgrades the company to Hold from Buy with a warning on growth in developing markets. The firm sees $60 as a fair valuation, a level which still marks an all-time high.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • LKM

    NetQin (NQ -3.1%) shares aren't benefiting from an announcement the company plans to buy back...

    NetQin (NQ -3.1%) shares aren't benefiting from an announcement the company plans to buy back $20M in shares over the next 12 months. Shares of the Chinese mobile security software firm are down 50% since May, in spite of the company's strong top-line growth, and now trade at just 6.3x estimated 2013 EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • FB

    BTIG's Richard Greenfield has joined Bernstein's Carlos Kirjner in upgrading Facebook (FB +6.8%)...

    BTIG's Richard Greenfield has joined Bernstein's Carlos Kirjner in upgrading Facebook (FB +6.8%) - the actions have driven shares above $25 for the first time since August. Greenfield, who now rates Facebook a Neutral, predicts Facebook's efforts to stuff its news feed with ads - something he still sees hurting the user experience - will help deliver Q4 revenue of $1.55B, above a $1.49B consensus. Kirjner, meanwhile, thinks the success of Facebook Exchange will slow down the pace at which PC ad sales drop.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 3 Comments
  • AAU

    Almaden Minerals (AAU +11.6%) shares surge on the discovery of a new volcanic hosted high-grade...

    Almaden Minerals (AAU +11.6%) shares surge on the discovery of a new volcanic hosted high-grade area along the trend of the Main Ixtaca Zone. For the first time in the Ixtaca drill program, visible gold was identified in a high grade sample from hole TU-12-224.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • DECK

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK +6.8%) clear $35 for the first time in a month, fueled by buzz...

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK +6.8%) clear $35 for the first time in a month, fueled by buzz the company could be on the radar of potential buyers. Wedbush thinks V.F. Corp (VFC -0.8%) could be one of the parties interested in the maker of Ugg boots and Teva sandals.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 2 Comments
  • SDRL

    Seadrill (SDRL -1.5%) opens lower after its Q3 profit surged on stronger revenue but results...

    Seadrill (SDRL -1.5%) opens lower after its Q3 profit surged on stronger revenue but results missed Wall Street estimates. In its conference call, SDRL says operational performance so far in Q4, while still being impacted by subsea issues experienced in Q3, is trending back to normal, and it anticipates significant improvement in Q4 results.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 2 Comments
  • MBI

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI) successfully completes a consent solicitation allowing amendments to its debt....

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI) successfully completes a consent solicitation allowing amendments to its debt. Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) had attempted to thwart the move, which effectively separates MBIA Insurance - the struggling unit which wrote insurance on subprime mortgages - from the healthy municipal insurance business, National Public Finance. Shares +7% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) trades higher, up 1% premarket, with this year's Cyber Monday of critical...

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) trades higher, up 1% premarket, with this year's Cyber Monday of critical importance to the company. A scan of the retailer's website shows a less promotional stance than some key rivals as the firm looks to still be leaning on extended warranties and service as its bread-and-butter.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • HOGS

    Premarket gainers: HOGS +16%. KCG +15%. MBI +8%. JRCC +8%.Losers: GNRC -6%. BCS -5%.

    Premarket gainers: HOGS +16%. KCG +15%. MBI +8%. JRCC +8%.
    Losers: GNRC -6%. BCS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • JRCCQ

    James River Coal (JRCC) +7.6% premarket after Raymond James upgrades shares to Outperform from...

    James River Coal (JRCC) +7.6% premarket after Raymond James upgrades shares to Outperform from Market Perform and sets a $3 price target, citing JRCC's ample liquidity, an expectation for a winter rally in U.S. natural gas prices, and the significant pullback in the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • HOGS

    Zhongpin (NASDAQ:HOGS) roars to a 16.6% gain premarket after the company agrees to merge with...

    Zhongpin (NASDAQ:HOGS) roars to a 16.6% gain premarket after the company agrees to merge with Golden Bridge Holdings. The going private deal is slated to go off at $13.50 a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • KCG

    Knight Capital (NYSE:KCG) surges 11.2% premarket following a weekend report it may sell its...

    Knight Capital (NYSE:KCG) surges 11.2% premarket following a weekend report it may sell its market-making operations. The unit - the market leader in ETF trading - remains profitable despite the big loss in August on a technical glitch.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • SDRL

    Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL): declares $0.85/share quarterly dividend, 1.2% increase from prior dividend...

    Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL): declares $0.85/share quarterly dividend, 1.2% increase from prior dividend of $0.84. Forward yield 8.61%. Shares -2.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • SDRL

    Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL): Q3 EPS of $0.40 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.68. Revenue of...

    Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL): Q3 EPS of $0.40 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.68. Revenue of $1.09B (+6.1% Y/Y). Shares -2.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM | 3 Comments
  • MT

    "We do not want Mittal in France any longer because they do not respect France," the country's...

    "We do not want Mittal in France any longer because they do not respect France," the country's industrial renewal minister says as the showdown between the new Socialist government and the steelmaker escalates. ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT) has shut down blast furnaces in Florange, eastern France, but wants to maintain its other activities there. MT -1.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM | 2 Comments
  • CCCL

    China Ceramics (NASDAQ:CCCL) declares its first-ever semi-annual dividend of $0.10/share....

    China Ceramics (NASDAQ:CCCL) declares its first-ever semi-annual dividend of $0.10/share. Forward yield 8.0%. For shareholders of record June 13. Payable July 13. Ex-div date June 11. Shares +3.6% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) +2.1% premarket, adding to Friday's huge gains, thanks to an upgrade...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) +2.1% premarket, adding to Friday's huge gains, thanks to an upgrade to Speculative Sector Outperformer from CIBC. Analyst Todd Coupland is optimistic about BlackBerry 10 upgrades, and considers shares undervalued even if service ARPUs decline. Though the BB10 launch event is still two months away and the platform's ability to halt RIM's share losses is far from guaranteed, RIM is now up 91% from its 52-week low and 45% from the Nov. 8 close.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • RNECY

    A fund backed by the Japanese government is set to pay $2.2B to buy 2/3 of chipmaker Renesas...

    A fund backed by the Japanese government is set to pay $2.2B to buy 2/3 of chipmaker Renesas (OTCPK:RNECY) from current owners Mitsubishi, NEC, and Hitachi, a source tells the Nikkei. Renesas, which rose 16.6% in Tokyo on the report, would reportedly shutter factories and cut as many as 5K jobs as part of the deal. Renesas is the top player in the microcontroller market, where it competes with Microchip, Freescale, STMicroelectronics, and others.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM
  • FB

    Facebook's (NASDAQ:FB) big run has made a believer of Bernstein's formerly bearish Carlos...

    Facebook's (NASDAQ:FB) big run has made a believer of Bernstein's formerly bearish Carlos Kirjner, who upgrades the stock to Outperform with a $33 price target (from $23). "Monetization of mobile gives Facebook more time to address challenges," he writes, expecting a series of earnings beats (or upward revisions to estimates) over the next year. Shares +2.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 AM | 9 Comments
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) is upgraded to Goldman Sachs' Conviction Buy list with a price target of $24...

    Yahoo (YHOO) is upgraded to Goldman Sachs' Conviction Buy list with a price target of $24 (raised from $22). Stock buybacks - just 25% complete - are the current catalyst. Combining that with what looks to be some credibility from new management, and it's a "very attractive risk/reward scenario." Shares +1.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 AM
  • BCS

    Barclays (NYSE:BCS) slides 4.2% premarket as Qatar's unloading of the remainder of its warrants...

    Barclays (NYSE:BCS) slides 4.2% premarket as Qatar's unloading of the remainder of its warrants in the bank acquired during the financial crisis triggers a 303M share stock offering at - you guessed it - about a 4% discount to Friday's closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:54 AM

  • Asian shares are mixed and European shares are lower after pro-independence parties won...

    Asian shares are mixed and European shares are lower after pro-independence parties won elections for Catalonia's regional assembly, although voters didn't provide an overwhelming mandate for a referendum on secession from Spain. Uncertainty over whether the Troika will at long last authorize the latest tranche of Greece's bailout is also depressing sentiment. Japan +0.2%, Hong Kong -0.2%, China -0.5%, India +0.2%. Euro Stoxx 50 -0.35%, London -0.1%, Paris -0.3%, Frankfurt flat, Milan -0.4%, Madrid -0.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 AM
